main.name: Marcus D. Norwood
main.bio: A creative individual that has worked for various companies across the U.S. supporting web and multimedia projects. I've recently started Dale Street Studio, LLC in 2021 to support clients.
main.webexperience: I have 12 years of full-time professional experience between web development, design, project management and system admin support. Spanning various systems due to the different companies I've worked for in the past. For development, I currently use React, Node, Firebase (NoSQL) and Javascript libraries like Redux, Hooks, ContextAPI, GraphQL, etc. Including using Create React App, Gatsby, or NextJS. Relying on Git, Heroku, Firebase and other workflows for version control and hosting. I can also implement and support CMS solutions like Drupal 8/9 & Wordpress with drag and drop site editing features via Gutenburg. I'm very comfortable with responsive design using CSS/SASS markup no matter the web stack. I prefer using Styled-Components if in React for better BEM markup pattern implementation. I'm flexible in using custom grids, flexbox, 3rd party grids like Bootstrap, etc. I also have past experience building projects with other web stacks like .Net MVC C#, .NET Webforms, classic ASP & vanilla HTML5/CSS/JS builds. As well working with various database types like SQL & MySQL.
main.multimediaexperience: I lean on the Adobe Creative Cloud suite with plently of experience in graphic design via Photoshop and Illustrator. Which is always a part of the web dev and support processes. More importantly as a web developer, I understand web optimized image types like JP2, JPX, JXR and WebP. I use Adobe XD, Figma, and Miro to help mockup site designs, user flows, UI wireframes, etc. Especially if a client wants something customized with going through the full design and user story/ux process. Although I can also just implement 3rd party contributed themes and get started on building sites with less features and navigation structures, if needing something presented quickly for small and medium sized sites. Especially if the client wants a particular design style that's already offered via other themes. Editing graphics, implementing Font Icons, and much more to get the necessary design style. I also have some experience with Motion Graphics for video in After Effect. Plus general video production and editing. Especially formatting video and audio to fit the various playback requirements on the web or elsewhere. For instance, exporting a particular set of formats for HTML5 video playback in all browser types. That, or mastering a stereo audio track for release on Spotify, etc.
main.audioexperience: I also specialize in audio with having 20+ years of experience as a musician and audio producer. Along with a bachelor of arts from BSU focused on audio production, sound design, and studio engineering. I'm now offering professional audio services with a modern hybrid analog/digital studio chain. Specializing in production, mixing & mastering. Plus audio repair. Utilizing SSL, R. Neve, a mastering grade converter, Akai, Izotope, Melodyne 5, and other hardware or software tools to get the job done. Taking years of experience and offering it to new artists and musicians on a per client basis. While continuing to work on my personal projects as a songwriter, producer and guitarist. See Dale Street Studio - Audio below in my portfolio (coming soon) for more audio services information if interested in seeing more.
main.contactmessage: Let me know if you have an exciting project that you know you'd like to work with me on, or if you'd just like to see if I'm insterested. I'd love to hear more!

education.school: Zero to Mastery and other online courses
education.description: Completion of various online courses in web development over the last 10 years. Between Pluralsight and Udemy. Most recently completing the React + Firebase Zero to Mastery course. Amongst other courses I'm always continuing to take as a life long learner.

A bachelor of arts in Telecommunications. With a focus on audio and multimedia production. That also included video and motion graphics, web design, but a far heavier focus and deeper dive into studio engineering and general sound design. Plus a minor in business technology for online systems.

work.title: Owner
work.description: My LLC dedicated to supporting select contract clients with web development, web design, system admin support & multimedia production. As well as offering professional audio services for a separate client base.

work.title: Web Project Manager, System Admin and Development
work.description: Web Project Manager & System Admin of large primary enterprise CMS + CRM implementation. Full development support and maintenance on a separate CMS Section Services instance.

work.title: Full Stack Web Developer
work.description: Full stack web development, database development and design utilizing .NET MVC, C# and SQL. Along with razor views and multimedia/graphics support.

work.title: Web Programmer II and Web Content Producer
work.description: Web Production & Multimedia - Supporting the School of Nursing with multimedia and online courses before moving on to support the School of Health Professions as the primary web developer and content support, but from the Provost office web & systems team. Which included classic ASP and .NET web pages with SQL. As well as responsive HTML/CSS/JS builds.

work.title: Web Design and Development
work.description: Implemented new HTML/CSS/JS site from the ground up with a custom code framework. Migrated hosts and implemented a new email marketing system to save the food bank money. As well as general IT training/support of food bank employees with a new inventory management database.

work.title: Web Design and Development, Motion Graphics
work.description: Fresh out of school and doing freelance projects in Houston/Galveston area at the time. It was my first taste of full time web design and development projects. Strictly static brochure design based sites at the time with minor PHP for contact forms. Building in my own custom CSS frameworks and elements. Before starting a long run as a full time employee for the next decade.

work.title: DJ & Barista
work.description: A DJ and hobbyist audio producer. Doing gigs at clubs, bars, private parties, etc. As well as a weekly club residency. Involvement in various bands and groups at the time. Also spent time as an island Barista and coffee shop manager. Before going to school to finish a bachelor's degree in Telecommunications at Ball State University. Then getting into a web career.
